FIELD_ACTOR_INVOKE: Executes the scripts attached to Actor
FIELD_SCENE_POP_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Pop the top scene state from stack.
FIELD_SCENE_POP_ALL_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Pop all scene state from stack.
FIELD_SCENE_RESET_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Clears the stack of saved scene states.
FIELD_STOP_MUSIC: Stops any music that was previously playing.
FIELD_SAVE_DATA: Save current game data to memory. Requires cartridge type with BATTERY.
FIELD_CLEAR_DATA: Clear all saved game data from memory.
FIELD_IF_SAVED_DATA: Run if player has saved a game.
FIELD_MATH_NOTE: Note: Variables have max values of 255 and will wrap if increased above 255 or below 0.
FIELD_MATH_NOTE_NO_CLAMP: Note: Without clamping enabled value will wrap if increased above 255 or below 0.
FIELD_GBC_FAST_CPU: Use Double Speed Mode (Improves CPU Performance)
FIELD_CUSTOM_EVENT_DESCRIPTION_PLACEHOLD: Describe the purpose of this script
FIELD_PERSIST_BETWEEN_SCENES_WARNING: Note: Some events like projectiles and sprite sheet changes currently don't work when used in an input script that is persisted between scenes.
FIELD_ALLOW_FASTFORWARD: Fast forward text while buttons held
FIELD_IF_COLOR_SUPPORTED: Run if the game is executing in a device that has color support.
FIELD_NUM_FRAMES_LABEL: Number of frames used by actors in scene
FIELD_NUM_SPRITE_TILES_LABEL: Number of tiles used by sprites in scene
FIELD_ACTORS_COUNT: This scene has used {actorCount} of {maxActors} available
FIELD_FRAMES_COUNT: This scene has used {frameCount} of {maxFrames} available
FIELD_SPRITE_TILES_COUNT: This scene has used {tileCount} of {maxTiles} available
FIELD_TRIGGERS_COUNT: This scene has used {triggerCount} of {maxTriggers} available
FIELD_TMP_DIRECTORY_INFO:
The location where temporary files are stored during the build of your game.
If you are unable to build your game due to permissions errors you can change this to a folder that you have access to.
FIELD_8BIT_DESCRIPTION: 8-bit number with a maximum value of 255.
FIELD_16BIT_DESCRIPTION: 16-bit number with a maximum value of 65535.
FIELD_16BIT_CALCULATION: Value is calculated using two 8-bit variables
FIELD_VARIABLE_NOT_USED: Variable hasn't been used in project
FIELD_CHOOSE_REPLACEMENT_DETAILS: Choose a replacement tile in the 'Tiles' panel.
FIELD_UI_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: GB Color background palette #8 is also used for UI elements like dialogue windows and menus
FIELD_EMOTE_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: GB Color sprite palette #8 is also used for emotes
FIELD_SGB_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: Super GB default palette is shared with GB Color palette #5, changing either will also update the other value.
FIELD_SPRITE_TILES_TOOLTIP:
The number of tiles used in this frame.

A maximum of 40 sprite tiles can be displayed on screen at once, and a maximum of 10 tiles can be displayed on the same horizontal row.
FIELD_SPRITE_UNIQUE_TILES_TOOLTIP:
This number of unique tiles used by this sprite in total across all animations.

Reduce the number of unique tiles to allow more sprites to be used in a single scene.
FIELD_AUTOMATIC_FADE_IN_DISABLED: Automatic Fade In is disabled for this scene
FIELD_AUTOMATIC_FADE_IN_DISABLED_INFO: You must add a "{eventName}" event manually.
FIELD_RNG_SEED_DESCRIPTION: Place this to run in response to user input to ensure random numbers change between playthroughs
FIELD_PASS_BY_VALUE_DESCRIPTION: This variable is being passed by value, any changes to the variable within the script will not affect the variable outside of the script
FIELD_PASS_BY_REFERENCE_DESCRIPTION: This variable is being passed by reference, any changes to the variable within the script will also change the variable from outside of the script
EVENT_PEEK_DATA: Store Variable from Game Data In Variable
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_FRAME_TO_VALUE: Set Actor Animation Frame Using Variable
EVENT_IF_DEVICE_SGB: If Super GB Mode Is Available
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_MOVEMENT_SPEED_LABEL: {actor} Set Movement Speed To {speed} Pixels Per Frame
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_SMALL: Background is too small, must be at least 160px x 144px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_LARGE: Background is too large, must be at most 256px x 256px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_NOT_MULTIPLE_OF_8: Background width or height is not a multiple of 8px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_WIDE: Background is too wide, was {width}px wide when maximum is {maxWidth}px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_TALL: Background is too tall, was {height}px tall when maximum is {maxHeight}px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_MANY_PIXELS: Background contains too many pixels, {numPixels} ({width}px * {height}px) when maximum is {maxPixels}
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_MANY_TILES: Background contains too many unique 8x8px tiles ({tilesetLength} where limit is {maxTilesetLength}) meaning it may not display correctly. Consider reducing the amount of detail in this image.
WARNING_MUSIC_TOO_LARGE: Music track {filename} is too large to fit in memory ({bytes} bytes when maximum is {maxBytes}). Consider reducing the number of patterns in the file.
WARNING_ENGINE_OUT_OF_DATE:
Ejected engine is out of date (found "{ejectedEngineVersion}" when latest is "{expectedEngineVersion}").
You may encounter issues if you don't eject your engine again.
WARNING_TOO_MANY_ONSCREEN_ACTORS: Too many actors may be onscreen at once around "{actorName}"
WARNING_ONSCREEN_ACTORS_LIMIT: Only {maxOnscreen} actors can be visible on screen at once
WARNING_FRAMES_LIMIT: This scene is over available limits and may have rendering issues. Try reducing number of actors in scene or use static and non animated sprites where possible. Stay within limits to prevent tile data overwriting sprite data
WARNING_SPRITE_TILES_LIMIT: This scene is over available limits and may have rendering issues. Try reducing number of actors in scene or simplify their sprites to use less unique tiles
WARNING_ACTORS_LIMIT: This scene contains too many actors, some actors will not be visible during gameplay
WARNING_TRIGGERS_LIMIT: This scene contains too many triggers, some triggers will not be included during gameplay
WARNING_NO_PLAYER_SET_FOR_SCENE_TYPE: No Default Player Sprite has been set for "{type}" scenes. Set one in the "Settings" section.
WARNING_LOGO_ENTITIES: Logo scenes cannot contain Actors or Triggers
ERROR_MOVED_OR_DELETED: It may have moved location or been deleted
ERROR_MISSING_FONTS: No fonts found in assets/fonts folder. An example font has been copied there for you to use.
SPLASH_SAMPLE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION: A GBC template containing examples of top down, platformer, point and click and shooter scenes
SPLASH_SAMPLE_PROJECT_ORIGINAL_DESCRIPTI: The original GB Studio template. A short 4 color top down game
SPLASH_NO_RECENT_PROJECTS: No projects have been opened recently.
DIALOG_SAVE_CHANGES: Do you want to save the changes you made to "{name}"?
DIALOG_SAVE_WARNING: Your changes will be lost if you don't save them.
DIALOG_UPDATE_DESCRIPTION: GB Studio {version} available. Would you like to update?
DIALOG_NEWEST_VERSION_AVAILABLE: GB Studio {version} is currently the newest version available.
DIALOG_UNABLE_TO_CHECK_LATEST_VERSION: Unable to check latest version at the moment
DIALOG_MIGRATION_DESCRIPTION:
Your project was created with version {currentVersion} and needs to be migrated to version {version}. This may prevent your project being opened in older versions of GB Studio.

It is recommended to back up your project before continuing.

Some manual changes to your project may be required, see migration guide for more details.
DIALOG_FUTURE_DESCRIPTION:
This project file was created with version {currentVersion} which is newer than this version of GB Studio supports. Maximum supported is {version}.

You may need to update GB Studio.
DIALOG_LANGUAGE_CHANGES_NEED_RESTART: GB Studio needs to restart before language changes can take effect
DIALOG_LANGUAGE_SAVE_AND_RESTART: Please save your project and restart the application.
DIALOG_DELETE_CUSTOM_EVENT_USED:
{count} uses of this event will also be removed.

Found in: {sceneNames}
DIALOG_DELETE_CUSTOM_EVENT_USED_SINGLAR:
{count} use of this event will also be removed.

Found in: {sceneNames}
DIALOG_EJECT_ENGINE_DESCRIPTION:
The latest GB Studio engine files will be copied to 'assets/engine'. You can make changes to any of these files and they will replace the default engine during builds.

To restore the default engine delete 'assets/engine'
DIALOG_EJECT_ENGINE_REPLACE_DESCRIPTION:
You have already ejected the GB Studio engine to your project.

If you continue the previously ejected files will be replaced and any changes you made will be lost.
DIALOG_ENABLE_COLOR_MODE_DESCRIPTION:
Your project currently has color mode disabled, would you like to enable it?

Color mode projects will work with both GB and GBC devices.

You can disable this later in 'Settings'.
DIALOG_REPLACE_CUSTOM_EVENT_DESCRIPTION: The pasted script contains a modified version of an existing script. Would you like to replace the script with the version on your clipboard or keep your existing script?
DIALOG_IMPORT_ASSET_DESCRIPTION: File asset type can not be automatically determined, where would you like to add this asset
DIALOG_TRACKER_CHANGES_NOT_SAVED: Do you want to save the changes you made to "{name}"?
DIALOG_TRACKER_CHANGES_NOT_SAVED_DESCRIP: Your changes to the current song will be lost if you don't save them.
ERROR_UNABLE_TO_SAVE_MUSIC_FILE_DESC: Double check the file you're trying to edit isn't Read-only
MESSAGE_ADD_UGE_FILES: Please add .uge files to the project assets/music folder. You can also create a new song with the + button above.
MESSAGE_USE_MOD_FILES: In order to use .mod files in your project you should change the current music driver from hUGEDriver to GBT Player. You can change this later in 'Settings'.
MESSAGE_ADD_MOD_FILES: Please add .mod files to the project assets/music folder.
MESSAGE_USE_UGE_FILES: To use .uge files in your project, change the music driver from GBT Player to hUGEDriver in 'Settings'.
